1.content:
You're running into a bundle of tightly coupled security headers that are blocking your WebContainer from running inside Vercel. Here's a breakdown of what's happening, why it's failing, and how to fix it.

üß† What's Causing the Problem
You‚Äôre trying to run a WebContainer (by StackBlitz) in an <iframe>, which requires advanced browser isolation features:

‚ùó Required by WebContainer:
Header    Purpose
Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy: require-corp    Enforces strict same-origin loading (for WebAssembly, SharedArrayBuffer, etc)
Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy: same-origin    Isolates browser contexts so SharedArrayBuffer is allowed
Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy: same-site    Allows embedded resources to load
Content-Security-Policy: script-src 'unsafe-eval'    Needed for certain dynamic code execution (required by WebContainer internals)

‚ùå Your Errors Explained
1. ERR_BLOCKED_BY_RESPONSE.NotSameOriginAfterDefaultedToSameOriginByCoep
This means the iframe's COEP: require-corp prevents loading scripts from external domains (like w-corp-staticblitz.com) because those scripts didn‚Äôt declare Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy headers.

‚ö†Ô∏è Vercel doesn‚Äôt automatically allow these headers in embedded iframes.

2. Content Security Policy of your site blocks the use of 'eval'
Vercel‚Äôs default CSP disables eval, but WebContainer internally uses eval / new Function.

Solution: You must modify CSP to include:

http
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
Content-Security-Policy: script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval'
‚úÖ How to Fix It
You must modify your Vercel headers configuration (via vercel.json or custom Next.js middleware).

‚úÖ Option 1: Use vercel.json
In your root project folder:

json
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
{
  "headers": [
    {
      "source": "/(.*)",
      "headers": [
        { "key": "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy", "value": "require-corp" },
        { "key": "Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy", "value": "same-origin" },
        { "key": "Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy", "value": "cross-origin" },
        { "key": "Content-Security-Policy", "value": "script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline'" }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
Then redeploy.

‚úÖ Option 2: Use Next.js Middleware Headers (if using Next.js)
In next.config.js:

js
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
module.exports = {
  async headers() {
    return [
      {
        source: "/(.*)",
        headers: [
          { key: "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy", value: "require-corp" },
          { key: "Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy", value: "same-origin" },
          { key: "Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy", value: "cross-origin" },
          { key: "Content-Security-Policy", value: "script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline'" }
        ]
      }
    ];
  }
};
Then redeploy.

üõë Important Caveats
Using 'unsafe-eval' is necessary for WebContainer but does introduce XSS risk if you‚Äôre not careful with user input.

This only works on modern Chromium-based browsers ‚Äî Safari and Firefox still have partial SharedArrayBuffer support issues.

If WebContainer‚Äôs vendor (w-corp-staticblitz.com) doesn‚Äôt send the right headers, you‚Äôre stuck until they do ‚Äî or need to proxy it yourself (not recommended).

1.content:
The error you're seeing:

pgsql
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
failed to initialize webcontainer: SharedArrayBuffer not available - cross-origin isolation required
indicates that WebContainers‚Äîused to back your Sandbox node‚Äîcannot run because Windows doesn‚Äôt have SharedArrayBuffer enabled. This feature is only usable when cross-origin isolation is properly set.

üö´ Why It's Still Not Displaying
Even if your site now deploys, the live preview may still fail because:

COOP/COEP headers may not be correctly applied on your deployed URL.

Service workers or caching layers might override or omit these headers intermittently (see Zoom forum discussions) 
github.com
+4
devforum.zoom.us
+4
answers.netlify.com
+4
github.com
+6
actualbudget.org
+6
reddit.com
+6
developer.mozilla.org
+2
github.com
+2
answers.netlify.com
+2
.

If React or React‚ÄëDOM versions are outdated, browsers may disable SharedArrayBuffer altogether 
stackoverflow.com
.

‚úÖ How to Verify & Fix
üîç Quick Check
Open your deployed app, then in DevTools:

js
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
console.log(window.crossOriginIsolated);
If this logs false, isolation isn't enabled‚ÄîWebContainer cannot boot.

üß© Correct HTTP Headers
These must be served with every page:

pgsql
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy: same-origin
Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy: require-corp
On Vercel, create a vercel.json:

json
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
{
  "headers": [
    {
      "source": "/(.*)",
      "headers": [
        { "key": "Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy", "value": "same-origin" },
        { "key": "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy", "value": "require-corp" }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
Or configure via next.config.js if you're using Next.js 
reddit.com
+8
vercel.com
+8
devforum.zoom.us
+8
.

‚öôÔ∏è In Local Dev (Vite)
Install vite-plugin-coi:

bash
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
pnpm add vite-plugin-coi -D
And add it to vite.config.ts:

ts
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
import { coiPlugin } from 'vite-plugin-coi';

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react(), coiPlugin()],
});
This injects the necessary headers for dev environments.

‚òëÔ∏è Ensure React Versions Are Update
Older React builds may not expose necessary globals. Make sure both react and react-dom are up-to-date (e.g. 17.0.2+) to avoid deprecation issues 
stackoverflow.com
+1
developer.mozilla.org
+1
.

üß† Why This Matters
Without cross-origin isolation, SharedArrayBuffer won‚Äôt work, and WebContainers will fail to initialize. This prevents your live preview from booting, though UI and backend agent simulation may appear to succeed.

1.content:
‚úÖ Solution: Enable Cross-Origin Isolation (COI)
To use SharedArrayBuffer, your app must be served with these headers:

h
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy: same-origin
Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy: require-corp
üõ†Ô∏è How to Fix It
üîπ If you‚Äôre using Vite:
You cannot run it from localhost without extra configuration. But you have options:

‚úÖ Option 1: Use vite-plugin-coi (recommended for dev)
Install the plugin:

bash
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
pnpm add vite-plugin-coi -D
Then add it to vite.config.ts:

ts
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react';
import { coiPlugin } from 'vite-plugin-coi';

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react(), coiPlugin()],
});
This automatically injects the needed headers for local dev.

‚úÖ Option 2: Serve with Static File Server that Adds COI Headers
If you deploy or serve statically, use serve or another tool that supports headers:

bash
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
serve -s dist --cors
(You‚Äôd need a more advanced config to inject COOP and COEP headers.)

‚úÖ Option 3: Use a Secure Hosting Environment (e.g. Cloudflare Pages, Vercel)
These support setting headers like:

http
Î≥µÏÇ¨
Ìé∏Ïßë
headers:
  - source: "**"
    headers:
      - key: "Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy"
        value: "same-origin"
      - key: "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy"
        value: "require-corp"
üö® Important Notes
This restriction is browser security policy, not your code.

Chrome, Firefox, and Edge all block SharedArrayBuffer unless COI is enabled.

WebContainer won't boot without it.

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Real Prompt-Aware File Generation  
**Agent Type**: UI + Backend Agents  
**Objective**: Connect OpenAI API (or Claude API) to generate actual React and Express code based on user prompts. Replace the current template file generators with prompt-aware generation logic.

**Relevant Files**:
- utils/fileContentGenerators.ts
- components/Nodes/UIAgentNode.tsx
- components/Nodes/BackendNode.tsx
- stores/apiKeysStore.ts (new)
- services/aiService.ts (new)

**Functionality Goals**:
- Use real AI API to convert assigned task (e.g. ‚ÄúCreate NoteEditor‚Äù) into file content
- Replace static templates with dynamic prompt-based results
- Support multi-file output (e.g. NoteEditor.tsx + utils.ts)
- Add fallback to templates if API fails

**API Setup**:
- Load OpenAI or Claude API key from env or Zustand store
- Call completion/chat API with a system prompt like:
  - ‚ÄúYou are a coding assistant. Generate a complete React component called NoteEditor for a notes app.‚Äù
- Stream or return response, parse into files

**Bonus**:
- Show loading spinner while fetching real output
- Add settings panel to input/change API key
- Support both OpenAI and Anthropic models

**Constraints**:
- Must return complete code with filename + content
- Should not require user to manually select models per agent
- Add retry logic or error message if API fails

**Success Criteria**:
- Prompt like "Build a blog app"
- UI + Backend agents each generate real code from AI
- Files sync to Sandbox and preview shows custom working app

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: File Synchronization from Agents ‚Üí Sandbox **Agent Type**: UI + Backend ‚Üí Sandbox Agent **Objective**: Send generated files from UIAgent and BackendAgent to the Sandbox Agent using messageBus or Zustand. Allow Sandbox to render a live app preview based on the combined files. **Relevant Files**: - stores/nodesStore.ts - stores/sandboxStore.ts - components/Nodes/SandboxNode.tsx - utils/webcontainerHelpers.ts - types/messages.ts (optional) **Functionality Goals**: - When UI or Backend Agent completes a task, send a `file_update` message with: - File path - File content - Sandbox Agent listens for those updates and: - Writes them to the in-memory filesystem (WebContainer) - Triggers dependency install (once) and dev server boot - Updates iframe with the new app preview **File Example**: ```ts { type: "file_update", from: "ui-agent-123", to: "sandbox", payload: { path: "/src/components/NoteEditor.tsx", content: "export default function NoteEditor() { return
Editor
; }" } }

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Agent Task Execution ‚Äì Backend Agent  
**Agent Type**: Backend Agent  
**Objective**: Enable BackendAgentNode to receive tasks from the Manager Agent and simulate generating backend logic (e.g., Express routes, services, database setup).

**Relevant Files**:
- components/Nodes/BackendNode.tsx
- types/agent.ts
- stores/nodesStore.ts

**Functionality Goals**:
- Display the assigned task (e.g., "Set up Notes API with CRUD routes")
- Simulate backend task stages:
  - Analyzing API structure
  - Creating route handlers
  - Connecting to database
  - Writing middleware
  - Preparing API preview

- Generate mock files like:
  - `/routes/notes.ts`
  - `/controllers/notesController.ts`
  - `/db/schema.ts`

- Show task progress with visual indicators and file list

**UI Design**:
- Progress stage indicators
- File generation view
- Console log output
- ‚ÄúRun API Preview‚Äù button placeholder (future integration with Sandbox)

**Constraints**:
- Task stages and timing should feel realistic (like the UI Agent)
- No need for real server code yet ‚Äî just visual simulation
- Use Zustand for state + reactivity

**Success Criteria**:
- When Manager spawns BackendAgentNode, it auto-starts task execution
- Progress bar updates through 5 clear backend stages
- File generation list populates live
- Logs show backend execution stages

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Agent Task Execution ‚Äì UI Agent  
**Agent Type**: UI Agent  
**Objective**: Enable UIAgentNode to receive its assigned task from Manager and start generating relevant React component scaffolds (just visual representation for now).

**Relevant Files**:
- components/Nodes/UIAgentNode.tsx
- stores/nodesStore.ts
- types/agent.ts

**Functionality Goals**:
- Show task data passed from Manager (e.g. ‚ÄúBuild NoteCard component‚Äù)
- Display a simulated list of files it‚Äôs working on (e.g., NoteCard.tsx, Editor.tsx)
- Add progress indicator or completion bar
- Use realistic mock data and status transitions

**UI Design**:
- Show agent‚Äôs name + status (e.g. ‚Äúscaffolding UI‚Äù)
- Progress bar with steps like:
  - Analyzing task
  - Creating files
  - Preparing preview

**Constraints**:
- No real file generation yet ‚Äî just visual + mock state
- Agent must render consistently even if multiple UI agents are spawned
- Logs can be printed to console

**Bonus**:
- Trigger task start when spawned
- Progress completes over a few seconds with fake stages

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Prompt Parsing + Manager Agent Logic  
**Agent Type**: Manager Agent  
**Objective**: Enable the ManagerNode to parse natural language user prompts and break them into tasks for other agents (e.g., UIAgent, BackendAgent). Simulate task assignment visually and log it.

**Relevant Files**:
- components/Canvas/PromptPanel.tsx
- components/Nodes/ManagerNode.tsx
- stores/nodesStore.ts
- types/messages.ts (if needed)

**Functionality Goals**:
- Add input box to PromptPanel where user can enter a high-level task (e.g., ‚ÄúBuild a chat app‚Äù)
- On submit, route prompt to ManagerNode
- ManagerNode:
  - Parses prompt into subtasks (mock or Claude-generated)
  - Spawns necessary agent nodes with sample task info
  - Logs task breakdown to console (for now)
- Connect newly spawned nodes to Manager

**UI Behavior**:
- Prompt input at top or left panel
- Output visually shows new agent nodes appearing on canvas
- Optional: Use different edge styles to show ‚Äútask assignment‚Äù

**Constraints**:
- Parsing logic can be mocked (you can hardcode subtasks for now)
- Node spawning must update Zustand + re-render canvas
- Don‚Äôt worry about real code generation yet ‚Äî just prompt ‚Üí plan ‚Üí spawn

**Success Criteria**:
- I can enter ‚ÄúBuild a notes app‚Äù
- ManagerNode parses it and spawns UI + Backend agent nodes
- Connection lines show logical flow
- Console logs show task breakdown

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Node Scaffolding  
**Agent Type**: Frontend Agent  
**Objective**: Enable draggable, connectable agent nodes inside the XYFlow canvas. Implement basic node types: `ManagerNode`, `UIAgentNode`, `BackendNode`.

**Relevant Files**:
- components/Canvas/FlowCanvas.tsx
- components/Nodes/BaseNode.tsx
- components/Nodes/ManagerNode.tsx
- components/Nodes/UIAgentNode.tsx
- components/Nodes/BackendNode.tsx
- types/nodes.ts

**Functionality Requirements**:
- Allow dynamic node spawning (just static list or sample nodes for now)
- Use `<ReactFlow>` from `@xyflow/react`
- Each node should be draggable and connectable
- Each node should have:
  - ID, type, label, and status (placeholder)
  - Tailwind-styled box with a title bar
  - Placeholder inner panel (we'll add editors later)

**Design**:
- Distinct color/theme for each agent type
- Rounded boxes with shadows
- Use `BaseNode` as a styled wrapper component

**Bonus if time**:
- Show connection lines between nodes
- Log connections to console for now

**Constraints**:
- Focus only on visuals and movement ‚Äî no task logic yet
- Don‚Äôt build sandbox or messageBus yet

1.content:
**Feature/Component**: Initial Canvas Shell + Live Server  
**Agent Type**: Frontend Agent  
**Objective**: 
1. Create the base layout for NeuronForge using React, Tailwind, and @xyflow/react.
2. Set up Vite so I can run the project live in the browser using `pnpm dev`.

**Relevant Files**:
- components/Canvas/CanvasLayout.tsx
- components/Canvas/PromptPanel.tsx
- components/Canvas/FlowCanvas.tsx
- main.tsx
- index.html
- vite.config.ts
- styles/globals.css
- package.json

**UI Layout Requirements**:
- Left: PromptPanel (for future chat input)
- Right: FlowCanvas (canvas area using `<ReactFlow />`)
- Header: Top bar with app title and placeholder buttons
- Responsive layout using Tailwind
- No node logic yet ‚Äî canvas can be empty

**Vite Setup Requirements**:
- Add Vite config if missing
- Include dev script in package.json
- Ensure Tailwind is configured properly
- Enable hot reload for easy iteration

**Success Criteria**:
- I can run `pnpm install && pnpm dev` in WSL and visit http://localhost:5173 to see the UI
- Layout should lo

history.display:
**Feature/Component**: Sandbox Initialization  
**Agent Type**: Sandbox Agent  
**Objective**: Create `SandboxNode.tsx` that boots a WebContainer instance, syncs files from Zustand, and renders a live preview using iframe.  
**Relevant Files**:
- components/Nodes/SandboxNode.tsx
- stores/sandboxStore.ts
- utils/webcontainerHelpers.ts

**Constraints**:
- Use `@webcontainer/api`
- Store lifecycle and files in `sandboxStore`
- Show iframe preview with `srcDoc`
- Display errors/output in a console panel

cachedChangelog:
# Changelog

## 1.0.35

- Added support for MCP OAuth Authorization Server discovery

## 1.0.34

- Fixed a memory leak causing a MaxListenersExceededWarning message to appear

## 1.0.33

- Improved logging functionality with session ID support
- Added undo functionality (Ctrl+Z and vim 'u' command)
- Improvements to plan mode

## 1.0.32

- Updated loopback config for litellm
- Added forceLoginMethod setting to bypass login selection screen

## 1.0.31

- Fixed a bug where ~/.claude.json would get reset when file contained invalid JSON

## 1.0.30

- Custom slash commands: Run bash output, @-mention files, enable thinking with thinking keywords
- Improved file path autocomplete with filename matching
- Added timestamps in Ctrl-r mode and fixed Ctrl-c handling
- Enhanced jq regex support for complex filters with pipes and select

## 1.0.29

- Improved CJK character support in cursor navigation and rendering

## 1.0.28

- Slash commands: Fix selector display during history navigation
- Resizes images before upload to prevent API size limit errors
- Added XDG_CONFIG_HOME support to configuration directory
- Performance optimizations for memory usage
- New attributes (terminal.type, language) in OpenTelemetry logging

## 1.0.27

- Streamable HTTP MCP servers are now supported
- Remote MCP servers (SSE and HTTP) now support OAuth
- MCP resources can now be @-mentioned
- /resume slash command to switch conversations within Claude Code

## 1.0.25

- Slash commands: moved "project" and "user" prefixes to descriptions
- Slash commands: improved reliability for command discovery
- Improved support for Ghostty
- Improved web search reliability

## 1.0.24

- Improved /mcp output
- Fixed a bug where settings arrays got overwritten instead of merged

## 1.0.23

- Released TypeScript SDK: import @anthropic-ai/claude-code to get started
- Released Python SDK: pip install claude-code-sdk to get started

## 1.0.22

- SDK: Renamed `total_cost` to `total_cost_usd`

## 1.0.21

- Improved editing of files with tab-based indentation
- Fix for tool_use without matching tool_result errors
- Fixed a bug where stdio MCP server processes would linger after quitting Claude Code

## 1.0.18

- Added --add-dir CLI argument for specifying additional working directories
- Added streaming input support without require -p flag
- Improved startup performance and session storage performance
- Added CLAUDE_BASH_MAINTAIN_PROJECT_WORKING_DIR environment variable to freeze working directory for bash commands
- Added detailed MCP server tools display (/mcp)
- MCP authentication and permission improvements
- Added auto-reconnection for MCP SSE connections on disconnect
- Fixed issue where pasted content was lost when dialogs appeared

## 1.0.17

- We now emit messages from sub-tasks in -p mode (look for the parent_tool_use_id property)
- Fixed crashes when the VS Code diff tool is invoked multiple times quickly
- MCP server list UI improvements
- Update Claude Code process title to display "claude" instead of "node"

## 1.0.11

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Pro subscription
- Added /upgrade for smoother switching to Claude Max plans
- Improved UI for authentication from API keys and Bedrock/Vertex/external auth tokens
- Improved shell configuration error handling
- Improved todo list handling during compaction

## 1.0.10

- Added markdown table support
- Improved streaming performance

## 1.0.8

- Fixed Vertex AI region fallback when using CLOUD_ML_REGION
- Increased default otel interval from 1s -> 5s
- Fixed edge cases where MCP_TIMEOUT and MCP_TOOL_TIMEOUT weren't being respected
- Fixed a regression where search tools unnecessarily asked for permissions
- Added support for triggering thinking non-English languages
- Improved compacting UI

## 1.0.7

- Renamed /allowed-tools -> /permissions
- Migrated allowedTools and ignorePatterns from .claude.json -> settings.json
- Deprecated claude config commands in favor of editing settings.json
- Fixed a bug where --dangerously-skip-permissions sometimes didn't work in --print mode
- Improved error handling for /install-github-app
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.6

- Improved edit reliability for tab-indented files
- Respect CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR everywhere
- Reduced unnecessary tool permission prompts
- Added support for symlinks in @file typeahead
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.4

- Fixed a bug where MCP tool errors weren't being parsed correctly

## 1.0.1

- Added `DISABLE_INTERLEAVED_THINKING` to give users the option to opt out of interleaved thinking.
- Improved model references to show provider-specific names (Sonnet 3.7 for Bedrock, Sonnet 4 for Console)
- Updated documentation links and OAuth process descriptions

## 1.0.0

- Claude Code is now generally available
- Introducing Sonnet 4 and Opus 4 models

## 0.2.125

- Breaking change: Bedrock ARN passed to `ANTHROPIC_MODEL` or `ANTHROPIC_SMALL_FAST_MODEL` should no longer contain an escaped slash (specify `/` instead of `%2F`)
- Removed `DEBUG=true` in favor of `ANTHROPIC_LOG=debug`, to log all requests

## 0.2.117

- Breaking change: --print JSON output now returns nested message objects, for forwards-compatibility as we introduce new metadata fields
- Introduced settings.cleanupPeriodDays
- Introduced CLAUDE_CODE_API_KEY_HELPER_TTL_MS env var
- Introduced --debug mode

## 0.2.108

- You can now send messages to Claude while it works to steer Claude in real-time
- Introduced BASH_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS and BASH_MAX_TIMEOUT_MS env vars
- Fixed a bug where thinking was not working in -p mode
- Fixed a regression in /cost reporting
- Deprecated MCP wizard interface in favor of other MCP commands
- Lots of other bugfixes and improvements

## 0.2.107

- CLAUDE.md files can now import other files. Add @path/to/file.md to ./CLAUDE.md to load additional files on launch

## 0.2.106

- MCP SSE server configs can now specify custom headers
- Fixed a bug where MCP permission prompt didn't always show correctly

## 0.2.105

- Claude can now search the web
- Moved system & account status to /status
- Added word movement keybindings for Vim
- Improved latency for startup, todo tool, and file edits

## 0.2.102

- Improved thinking triggering reliability
- Improved @mention reliability for images and folders
- You can now paste multiple large chunks into one prompt

## 0.2.100

- Fixed a crash caused by a stack overflow error
- Made db storage optional; missing db support disables --continue and --resume

## 0.2.98

- Fixed an issue where auto-compact was running twice

## 0.2.96

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Max subscription (https://claude.ai/upgrade)

## 0.2.93

- Resume conversations from where you left off from with "claude --continue" and "claude --resume"
- Claude now has access to a Todo list that helps it stay on track and be more organized

## 0.2.82

- Added support for --disallowedTools
- Renamed tools for consistency: LSTool -> LS, View -> Read, etc.

## 0.2.75

- Hit Enter to queue up additional messages while Claude is working
- Drag in or copy/paste image files directly into the prompt
- @-mention files to directly add them to context
- Run one-off MCP servers with `claude --mcp-config <path-to-file>`
- Improved performance for filename auto-complete

## 0.2.74

- Added support for refreshing dynamically generated API keys (via apiKeyHelper), with a 5 minute TTL
- Task tool can now perform writes and run bash commands

## 0.2.72

- Updated spinner to indicate tokens loaded and tool usage

## 0.2.70

- Network commands like curl are now available for Claude to use
- Claude can now run multiple web queries in parallel
- Pressing ESC once immediately interrupts Claude in Auto-accept mode

## 0.2.69

- Fixed UI glitches with improved Select component behavior
- Enhanced terminal output display with better text truncation logic

## 0.2.67

- Shared project permission rules can be saved in .claude/settings.json

## 0.2.66

- Print mode (-p) now supports streaming output via --output-format=stream-json
- Fixed issue where pasting could trigger memory or bash mode unexpectedly

## 0.2.63

- Fixed an issue where MCP tools were loaded twice, which caused tool call errors

## 0.2.61

- Navigate menus with vim-style keys (j/k) or bash/emacs shortcuts (Ctrl+n/p) for faster interaction
- Enhanced image detection for more reliable clipboard paste functionality
- Fixed an issue where ESC key could crash the conversation history selector

## 0.2.59

- Copy+paste images directly into your prompt
- Improved progress indicators for bash and fetch tools
- Bugfixes for non-interactive mode (-p)

## 0.2.54

- Quickly add to Memory by starting your message with '#'
- Press ctrl+r to see full output for long tool results
- Added support for MCP SSE transport

## 0.2.53

- New web fetch tool lets Claude view URLs that you paste in
- Fixed a bug with JPEG detection

## 0.2.50

- New MCP "project" scope now allows you to add MCP servers to .mcp.json files and commit them to your repository

## 0.2.49

- Previous MCP server scopes have been renamed: previous "project" scope is now "local" and "global" scope is now "user"

## 0.2.47

- Press Tab to auto-complete file and folder names
- Press Shift + Tab to toggle auto-accept for file edits
- Automatic conversation compaction for infinite conversation length (toggle with /config)

## 0.2.44

- Ask Claude to make a plan with thinking mode: just say 'think' or 'think harder' or even 'ultrathink'

## 0.2.41

- MCP server startup timeout can now be configured via MCP_TIMEOUT environment variable
- MCP server startup no longer blocks the app from starting up

## 0.2.37

- New /release-notes command lets you view release notes at any time
- `claude config add/remove` commands now accept multiple values separated by commas or spaces

## 0.2.36

- Import MCP servers from Claude Desktop with `claude mcp add-from-claude-desktop`
- Add MCP servers as JSON strings with `claude mcp add-json <n> <json>`

## 0.2.34

- Vim bindings for text input - enable with /vim or /config

## 0.2.32

- Interactive MCP setup wizard: Run "claude mcp add" to add MCP servers with a step-by-step interface
- Fix for some PersistentShell issues

## 0.2.31

- Custom slash commands: Markdown files in .claude/commands/ directories now appear as custom slash commands to insert prompts into your conversation
- MCP debug mode: Run with --mcp-debug flag to get more information about MCP server errors

## 0.2.30

- Added ANSI color theme for better terminal compatibility
- Fixed issue where slash command arguments weren't being sent properly
- (Mac-only) API keys are now stored in macOS Keychain

## 0.2.26

- New /approved-tools command for managing tool permissions
- Word-level diff display for improved code readability
- Fuzzy matching for slash commands

## 0.2.21

- Fuzzy matching for /commands
